name: 130 E 62nd St
description: About 130 E 62nd St New York, NY 10065 We specialize in furnished short term rental apartments, extended-stay & corporate housing accommodations in the heart of New York City on the Upper East Side of Manhattan. As the Townhouse was built in 1871, it is not handicap accessible. All apartments are accessed via our central open staircase. There isn't an elevator. We regret we are unable to accommodate pets (sorry, no exceptions). Smoking is not permitted. All stays must meet our 30-90 day min. Annual contracts are welcome.  The Brownstone: -This suite is one of several housed within the classic late 1800s era NYC brownstone townhouse known as 1871 House since 1998. The five-story Italianate style brownstone was designed by John Sexton and built in 1871 as part of a row of four single family brownstone houses -The brownstone building, which sits within the Upper East Side Historic District, presently offers a collection of one-of-a kind suites and suite apartments dedicated to the extended stay market. The generously sized suites and apartments are housed within the 5-story classic 1870's era brownstone tucked among other gorgeous townhouse and historic buildings on an inviting residential street between Park and Lexington Avenues. The historic turn-of-the-century brownstone brings style and easy access to the busy city.  -The wonderful stylized apartments of the townhouse feature a mix of antique and good quality reproduction furniture, hardwood floors, beautiful beds, en-suite private bathrooms, as well as high ceilings, marble fireplace mantels and modern amenities such as flat-screen TVs and Wi-Fi.  -Rooms in the front part of the house have quite stunning views of the townhouse mansions and brownstones immediately across the street from the house. Serene garden views to the Rear.  -The townhouse apartments offer stylish accommodations conveniently located a couple of blocks from Central Park, Madison Avenue shopping and Manhattan’s finest restaurants and cafes.  -There is virtually nothing comparable in the prime NYC location. If interested in applying:  o	Please send a quick introductory message with you inquiry.  o	Also include:  o	What brings you to the area? o	How many Guests will need to be accommodated - all individuals who would occupy the apartment must be disclosed in advance (2 guests maximum per suite). o	Please confirm you do not smoke or have a pet. Supplemental Fees & House Rules: * 	In addition to the base monthly charge, all stays are subject to supplemental fees & tax as follows: * 	A bundled flat rate monthly fee for wifi, electric, hot/cold water, heat, gas (if applicable), monthly cleaning and exit cleaning. Monthly cleanings include linen service. o	Lodging and Room Tax 5.875% + $2/room/night. * 	Guests must pay all fees & taxes if staying less than 180 days (tax waived if staying 180 days or longer)  * 	A Security Deposit * 	Third party bookings are not permitted.  *  1871 House is a converted 148-year-old Brownstone. In that it is a historic building constructed in the year 1871 there is no elevator in the building. All suites are accessed via our central open staircase. Guests must transport their luggage to their booked accommodations.  * 	Guests will be asked to fill out an informational questionnaire/application and to submit a copy of their government-issued ID. This could be a driver's license, passport or visa. * 	Guests shall use the apartments or suites for residential/living purposes only (WFH exception).  * 	Guests may work from home (home office use only) provided that no employees or clients come to the apartment.  * 	Guests are prohibited from running a business, manufacturing, selling goods or products (inventory) for the apartment or using the rented premises as an art studio to paint or to create artwork from.  * 	Smoking is not permitted in the building, rooms, apartments, terrace, in any common/public areas surrounding the Premises or including 25 feet from the building. * 	Fireplaces are decorative. * 	Guests are liable for stains on bedding, rugs, upholstery, etc. * 	Host may request to show the apartment to prospective Guests. Host will give guest advance notice. *  We ask guests to be prepared to abide by the house rules outlined in this listing and be respectful of the accommodation. * 	We may decline stand-alone one-month reservations that leave undesirable gaps in our schedule. Terms & Conditions: 1.Occupancy & Guests  a.	All individuals who would occupy the Premises during the rental term must be disclosed prior to making a reservation. b.	The occupancy agreement is based on a specific number of occupants. The number of occupants as specified in the rental agreement must be adhered to.  c.	Only guests in the original reservation whose IDs are verified in advance are permitted to stay in the apartment.  d.	If the number of guests staying in the apartment exceeds the number indicated on the confirmed reservation, the guest will be required to pay the daily charge of $100/night for each additional person not registered. e.	Overnight Guests and Supplemental Occupants: There is a supplemental fee to add a supplemental guest daily or monthly. The fee covers additional operating expenses such as wear and tear, utilities, more prep and cleaning, water (showers, toilets, sink us), supplies such as towels and bedding, laundry & internet use.  f.	The primary renter may have 1 occasional overnight guest provided the primary renter has provided the maximum occupancy limit (as stated herein) for the suite is not violated and advance notice has been provided to the host.  g.	The primary renter of the suite must be physically present if hosting an overnight guest. h.	Beds may not be added to any of the suites. 2. If a child under 10 years of age will be in occupancy (even part time) provisions must be made for the installation of window guards as per NYC regs. Guests/Occupants pay the cost of the window guards hardware and installation @ an estimated cost of $150/window (6 windows). Children under 10 years may not reside in the apartment unless window guards are installed. A lead time of 10 days is required for the arrangement of window guard installation.  3.	PETS: Guest agrees that they will not bring any PETS into the Accommodation 4.	Furniture: Guest agrees not to bring any furniture into the suite or to move furniture within the apartment. 5.	DAMAGES: Guest is liable for the full costs of any damages.The security deposit shall be returned only after inspection by Provider/Host and Provider/Host determines that no damages, loss or injury (other than from reasonable wear and tear) has been done to the premises or property therein and that all charges and fees have been paid. Any deductions from the security deposit shall be documented. Full List of Policies available by request. 130 E 62nd St is an apartment located in Manhattan County, the 10065 ZIP Code, and the attendance zone.

name: 140 E 40th St
description: About 140 E 40th St New York, NY 10016 LEASES SIGNED-2J at 140 East 40th Street in Murray Hill is your own little piece of heaven in New York City! This FULLY RENOVATED spacious sanctuary is perfectly positioned inside one of Murray Hill's most dramatic and well preserved Art Deco buildings! Featuring the most sought after PreWar details such as an entry foyer with graceful archway giving access to a beautifully proportioned room as well as high beamed ceilings, original casement windows, and three very generous closets. The apartment also features brand new oak floors and a windowed bathroom with extra deep soaking tub and glass enclosure extending all the way to the ceiling. The sleek and modern fully renovated kitchen includes a dishwasher, convection oven, built in water filter, and custom cabinets. Chic lighting is also included throughout the apartment. No detail has been overlooked. The unit comes with a modern style murphy bed and the unit itself can also be rented furnished for $2350. This well managed coop, designed by Bien and Prince, the same architects who have also designed the Carlyle hotel, boasts a grand Art Deco lobby with terrazzo floors, Le Corbusier designed seating and a sleek 1930's fireplace. Within this exquisite building you will find two elevators, a package room, central laundry room with new washers and dryers, live-in super, part time security guard, fully furnished and landscaped roof deck with stunning views of the Empire State Building as well as both bike storage and personal storage available for an additional fee. (waitlist may apply) It is conveniently located within minutes from Grand Central Station, one of Manhattan's largest transportation hubs as well as easy access to all the best fine dining, shopping, and night life that the East Side of Manhattan has to offer. Sorry, dogs are not permitted! 140 E 40th St is a condo located in Manhattan County, the 10016 ZIP Code, and the New York City Geographic District # 2 attendance zone.

name: 685 1st Ave. Unit 8E
description: About 685 1st Ave. New York, NY 10016 We are offering private, by appointment, virtual presentations and on-site tours 7 days a week. To schedule your appointment, please contact the 685 First Avenue leasing team and learn more about our current showing protocol.Residence 8E is a two-bedroom with city views. Ceilings close to nine feet with floor-to-ceiling windows allow for maximum openness and natural light. White oak floors are found in all residences and open kitchens boast white Caesarstone quartz counters, Grohe polished fixtures and Bosch appliances clad in custom-crafted Italian white lacquer. Spacious bathrooms feature Carrara marble stone floors and white Thassos marble stone walls which complement the Grohe & Dornbracht polished chrome fixtures and custom Italian vanity. Each residence is equipped with a high performance, multi-zoned heating and cooling system for individual year-round climate control. Select residences offer private outdoor space with panoramic city views.685 First Avenue is situated in a prominent Manhattan location on First Avenue between East 39th and East 40th Streets. Brought to you by the renowned Solow Building Company, this iconic 43-story tower is clad in black glass, a Solow trademark. The 43-story, 460-foot high residential tower is comprised of 408 studio-to-three-bedroom rental residences on the 3rd through 27th floor, including a collection of oversized loft residences. Located just south of the United Nations Headquarters along the East River, residences feature breathtaking views of New York City and the riverfront. One of its most distinguishing features - a clear glass cut-out on the 28th and 29th floors - lights up at night and is visible from across the river. The western facade is defined by a glass screen that provides privacy for residence balconies while still allowing abundant natural light to fill the interior space.Residents of 685 First Avenue will enjoy the highest level of service from the moment they arrive. Whether entering from First Avenue through the grand East Atrium adorned in travertine, or the discreet direct entry from the onsite parking garage, the building has been carefully designed for the ultimate convenience and luxury. The amenities suite has been designed with soaring ceiling heights and naturally lit spaces to promote residents' health and wellness, including a 70' indoor lap pool with steam and sauna and expansive fitness center with private training studio. Residents can also enjoy thoughtfully curated entertaining spaces featuring a billiards and games lounge, catering kitchen, private dining, screening room, and playroom.685 First Avenue transforms the East River skyline and brings a new standard of luxury living to Midtown East. 685 1st Ave. is an apartment located in Manhattan County, the 10016 ZIP Code, and the attendance zone.

name: 400 5th Ave Unit 57-E
description: About 400 5th Ave New York, NY 10018 The Chrysler Building from your study. Central Park from your living room. The Hudson River from your bathtub. And all you need to bring is your suitcase. This fully furnished unit on the 57th floor of The Residences at 400 Fifth Avenue features the white-glove service and amazing amenities of The Langham Hotel, and is completely move-in ready. Inside, the apartment has breathtaking views from eastern, western, and northern exposure. This 3BR/3B includes a massive living room, a top-of-the-line open kitchen, excellent storage, and a washer/dryer. Besides the furniture, it comes complete with Wi-Fi, cable TV, and Sonos Surround Sound. Everything is easy here: the condo has access to all the amenities of the 5-star hotel, including room-service, the Michelin-starred Ai Fiori, a spa, a massive fitness center, and also a residents' lounge with an outdoor terrace. Outside, the best of Manhattan is at your fingertips. Down the block is the legendary Keens Steakhouse, with other favorites like Her Name is Han, Scarpetta, and the Ace Hotel only minutes away. There are world-class museums like The Morgan Library and plenty of green space at Bryant Park. Nearby retail includes the design corridor on Madison Avenue, the convenience of Herald Square, and a never-crowded Whole Foods. With all this, you may never want to leave the neighborhood. But if you must, you have easy access to the B,D,F,M,N,Q,R,4,5,6 trains and both LIRR at Penn Station, and Metro North at Grand Central. Call today and call 400 Fifth Avenue home. 400 5th Ave is a condo located in Manhattan County, the 10018 ZIP Code, and the New York City Geographic District # 2 attendance zone.

name: 172 E 61st St Unit 4-A
description: About 172 E 61st St New York, NY 10065 This spacious and light-filled apartment is set right in the heart of the action and is only moments from bustling cafes, public transportation, entertainment and Central Park. The one-bedroom, one-bathroom layout boasts a generous living room and a windowed office where you can work from home. Set right in the heart of the floorplan is the well-appointed kitchen with ample cabinetry, a dishwasher and a pass-through to the home office, which would make the ideal dining room. Two large windows bathe the living room in soft natural light plus there's ample closet space throughout for convenience. The bedroom is large enough to comfortably accommodate a king-size bed and additional furniture while a huge walk-in closet is also all yours to enjoy. This prized 61st St location places you above the iconic Isle of Capri restaurant and you're also only moments from the 4, 5, 6, N, R, W, Q & F trains. name: 685 1st Ave. Unit 5C
description: About 685 1st Ave. New York, NY 10016 We are offering private, by appointment, virtual presentations and on-site tours 7 days a week. To schedule your appointment, please contact the 685 First Avenue leasing team and learn more about our current showing protocol.Residence 5C is a generously proportioned two bedroom with river views. Ceilings close to nine feet with floor-to-ceiling windows allow for maximum openness and natural light. White oak floors are found in all residences and open kitchens boast white Caesarstone quartz counters, Grohe polished fixtures and Bosch appliances clad in custom-crafted Italian white lacquer. Spacious bathrooms feature Carrara marble stone floors and white Thassos marble stone walls which complement the Grohe& Dornbracht polished chrome fixtures and custom Italian vanity. Each residence is equipped with a high performance, multi-zoned heating and cooling system for individual year-round climate control. Select residences offer private outdoor space with panoramic city views.685 First Avenue is situated in a prominent Manhattan location on First Avenue between East 39th and East 40th Streets. Brought to you by the renowned Solow Building Company, this iconic 43-story tower is clad in black glass, a Solow trademark. The 43-story, 460-foot high residential tower is comprised of 408 studio-to-three-bedroom rental residences on the 3rd through 27th floor, including a collection of oversized loft residences. Located just south of the United Nations Headquarters along the East River, residences feature breathtaking views of New York City and the riverfront. One of its most distinguishing features - a clear glass cut-out on the 28th and 29th floors - lights up at night and is visible from across the river. The western facade is defined by a glass screen that provides privacy for residence balconies while still allowing abundant natural light to fill the interior space.Residents of 685 First Avenue will enjoy the highest level of service from the moment they arrive. Whether entering from First Avenue through the grand East Atrium adorned in travertine, or the discreet direct entry from the onsite parking garage, the building has been carefully designed for the ultimate convenience and luxury. The amenities suite has been designed with soaring ceiling heights and naturally lit spaces to promote residents' health and wellness, including a 70' indoor lap pool with steam and sauna and expansive fitness center with private training studio. Residents can also enjoy thoughtfully curated entertaining spaces featuring a billiards and games lounge, catering kitchen, private dining, screening room, and playroom.685 First Avenue transforms the East River skyline and brings a new standard of luxury living to Midtown East. 685 1st Ave. is an apartment located in Manhattan County, the 10016 ZIP Code, and the attendance zone.

name: 40 E 61st St Unit 10C
description: About 40 E 61st St New York, NY 10065 -Showings only allowed Monday-thru-Friday from 9am-5pm.-One year lease available, starting January 2022. Welcome to 10C! This fully renovated CONDO apartment in a boutique building features two private balconies with adjacent views of Central Park and triple exposure (East, West, North). Abundant light from its oversized and newly encased windows is seen throughout the day.As you enter 10C, youll notice the wealth of outfitted smart California closets that seamlessly blend with the designed walls and add lots of storage. The open chefs kitchen features Italian cabinets, Silestone countertops, Subzero Fridge with two freezer drawers, Smeg Oven & Cooktop, Miele Hood, Wine cooler and microwave, all with plenty of cabinet space. The floors were upgraded with bespoke rustic walnut antique wood and custom made cabinetry from reclaimed wood with Lacquer finishing. A home office area by the window and balcony adds to the charm and use of the living and entertainment spaces.The oversized bathrooms are finished with Thassos Marble, Italian sinks, glass mosaic tiles, walnut cabinetry, Toto toilets and Waterworks Fixtures. Theres a Miele Washer and Dryer inside the unit conveniently located by the hallway between the bedrooms.The bedrooms are both oversized and feature multiple California closets. The corner Master Bedroom includes its own private balcony, perfect for that morning coffee , and a wall of cabinetry with walnut and lacquer finishing to add to the storage of the apartment. New HVAC units with thermostats in every room were installed along with motorized remote controlled blackout and solar shades.40 East 61st Street is a boutique pre-war condominium located between Madison and Park Avenues. Built in 1928, with 36 apartments on 19 floors, the building is located by some of the most recognized Upper East Side restaurants and just a block away from Central Park. 40 E 61st St is a condo located in Manhattan County, the 10065 ZIP Code, and the New York City Geographic District # 2 attendance zone.

name: 130 E 62nd St
description: About 130 E 62nd St New York, NY 10065 We specialize in furnished short term rental apartments, extended-stay & corporate housing accommodations in the heart of New York City on the Upper East Side of Manhattan. As the Townhouse was built in 1871, it is not handicap accessible. All apartments are accessed via our central open staircase. There isn't an elevator. We regret we are unable to accommodate pets (sorry, no exceptions). Smoking is not permitted. All stays must meet our 30-90 day min. Annual contracts are welcome.  The Brownstone: -This suite is one of several housed within the classic late 1800s era NYC brownstone townhouse known as 1871 House since 1998. The five-story Italianate style brownstone was designed by John Sexton and built in 1871 as part of a row of four single family brownstone houses -The brownstone building, which sits within the Upper East Side Historic District, presently offers a collection of one-of-a kind suites and suite apartments dedicated to the extended stay market. The generously sized suites and apartments are housed within the 5-story classic 1870's era brownstone tucked among other gorgeous townhouse and historic buildings on an inviting residential street between Park and Lexington Avenues. The historic turn-of-the-century brownstone brings style and easy access to the busy city.  -The wonderful stylized apartments of the townhouse feature a mix of antique and good quality reproduction furniture, hardwood floors, beautiful beds, en-suite private bathrooms, as well as high ceilings, marble fireplace mantels and modern amenities such as flat-screen TVs and Wi-Fi.  -Rooms in the front part of the house have quite stunning views of the townhouse mansions and brownstones immediately across the street from the house. Serene garden views to the Rear.  -The townhouse apartments offer stylish accommodations conveniently located a couple of blocks from Central Park, Madison Avenue shopping and Manhattan’s finest restaurants and cafes.  -There is virtually nothing comparable in the prime NYC location. If interested in applying:  o	Please send a quick introductory message with you inquiry.  o	Also include:  o	What brings you to the area? o	How many Guests will need to be accommodated - all individuals who would occupy the apartment must be disclosed in advance (2 guests maximum per suite). o	Please confirm you do not smoke or have a pet. Supplemental Fees & House Rules: * 	In addition to the base monthly charge, all stays are subject to supplemental fees & tax as follows: * 	A bundled flat rate monthly fee for wifi, electric, hot/cold water, heat, gas (if applicable), monthly cleaning and exit cleaning. Monthly cleanings include linen service. o	Lodging and Room Tax 5.875% + $2/room/night. * 	Guests must pay all fees & taxes if staying less than 180 days (tax waived if staying 180 days or longer)  * 	A Security Deposit * 	Third party bookings are not permitted.  *  1871 House is a converted 148-year-old Brownstone. In that it is a historic building constructed in the year 1871 there is no elevator in the building. All suites are accessed via our central open staircase. Guests must transport their luggage to their booked accommodations.  * 	Guests will be asked to fill out an informational questionnaire/application and to submit a copy of their government-issued ID. This could be a driver's license, passport or visa. * 	Guests shall use the apartments or suites for residential/living purposes only (WFH exception).  * 	Guests may work from home (home office use only) provided that no employees or clients come to the apartment.  * 	Guests are prohibited from running a business, manufacturing, selling goods or products (inventory) for the apartment or using the rented premises as an art studio to paint or to create artwork from.  * 	Smoking is not permitted in the building, rooms, apartments, terrace, in any common/public areas surrounding the Premises or including 25 feet from the building. * 	Fireplaces are decorative. * 	Guests are liable for stains on bedding, rugs, upholstery, etc. * 	Host may request to show the apartment to prospective Guests. Host will give guest advance notice. *  We ask guests to be prepared to abide by the house rules outlined in this listing and be respectful of the accommodation. * 	We may decline stand-alone one-month reservations that leave undesirable gaps in our schedule. Terms & Conditions: 1.Occupancy & Guests  a.	All individuals who would occupy the Premises during the rental term must be disclosed prior to making a reservation. b.	The occupancy agreement is based on a specific number of occupants. The number of occupants as specified in the rental agreement must be adhered to.  c.	Only guests in the original reservation whose IDs are verified in advance are permitted to stay in the apartment.  d.	If the number of guests staying in the apartment exceeds the number indicated on the confirmed reservation, the guest will be required to pay the daily charge of $100/night for each additional person not registered. e.	Overnight Guests and Supplemental Occupants: There is a supplemental fee to add a supplemental guest daily or monthly. The fee covers additional operating expenses such as wear and tear, utilities, more prep and cleaning, water (showers, toilets, sink us), supplies such as towels and bedding, laundry & internet use.  f.	The primary renter may have 1 occasional overnight guest provided the primary renter has provided the maximum occupancy limit (as stated herein) for the suite is not violated and advance notice has been provided to the host.  g.	The primary renter of the suite must be physically present if hosting an overnight guest. h.	Beds may not be added to any of the suites. 2. If a child under 10 years of age will be in occupancy (even part time) provisions must be made for the installation of window guards as per NYC regs. Guests/Occupants pay the cost of the window guards hardware and installation @ an estimated cost of $150/window (6 windows). Children under 10 years may not reside in the apartment unless window guards are installed. A lead time of 10 days is required for the arrangement of window guard installation.  3.	PETS: Guest agrees that they will not bring any PETS into the Accommodation 4.	Furniture: Guest agrees not to bring any furniture into the suite or to move furniture within the apartment. 5.	DAMAGES: Guest is liable for the full costs of any damages.The security deposit shall be returned only after inspection by Provider/Host and Provider/Host determines that no damages, loss or injury (other than from reasonable wear and tear) has been done to the premises or property therein and that all charges and fees have been paid. Any deductions from the security deposit shall be documented. The generously sized suites and apartments are housed within the 5-story classic 1870's era brownstone tucked among other gorgeous townhouse and historic buildings on an inviting residential street between Park and Lexington Avenues. Serene garden views to the Rear.  -The townhouse apartments offer stylish accommodations conveniently located a couple of blocks from Central Park, Madison Avenue shopping and Manhattan’s finest restaurants and cafes.  -There is virtually nothing comparable in the prime NYC location. Overnight Guests and Supplemental Occupants: There is a supplemental fee to add a supplemental guest daily or monthly. The primary renter may have 1 occasional overnight guest provided the primary renter has provided the maximum occupancy limit (as stated herein) for the suite is not violated and advance notice has been provided to the host.  g.	The primary renter of the suite must be physically present if hosting an overnight guest. h.	Beds may not be added to any of the suites. 2. If a child under 10 years of age will be in occupancy (even part time) provisions must be made for the installation of window guards as per NYC regs. DAMAGES: Guest is liable for the full costs of any damages.The security deposit shall be returned only after inspection by Provider/Host and Provider/Host determines that no damages, loss or injury (other than from reasonable wear and tear) has been done to the premises or property therein and that all charges and fees have been paid. The Brownstone: -This suite is one of several housed within the classic late 1800s era NYC brownstone townhouse known as 1871 House since 1998. The five-story Italianate style brownstone was designed by John Sexton and built in 1871 as part of a row of four single family brownstone houses -The brownstone building, which sits within the Upper East Side Historic District, presently offers a collection of one-of-a kind suites and suite apartments dedicated to the extended stay market. The generously sized suites and apartments are housed within the 5-story classic 1870's era brownstone tucked among other gorgeous townhouse and historic buildings on an inviting residential street between Park and Lexington Avenues. The historic turn-of-the-century brownstone brings style and easy access to the busy city.  -The wonderful stylized apartments of the townhouse feature a mix of antique and good quality reproduction furniture, hardwood floors, beautiful beds, en-suite private bathrooms, as well as high ceilings, marble fireplace mantels and modern amenities such as flat-screen TVs and Wi-Fi.  -Rooms in the front part of the house have quite stunning views of the townhouse mansions and brownstones immediately across the street from the house. Serene garden views to the Rear.  -The townhouse apartments offer stylish accommodations conveniently located a couple of blocks from Central Park, Madison Avenue shopping and Manhattan’s finest restaurants and cafes.  -There is virtually nothing comparable in the prime NYC location. name: 130 E 62nd St
description: About 130 E 62nd St New York, NY 10065 We specialize in furnished short term rental apartments, extended-stay & corporate housing accommodations in the heart of New York City on the Upper East Side of Manhattan. As the Townhouse was built in 1871, it is not handicap accessible. All apartments are accessed via our central open staircase. There isn't an elevator. We regret we are unable to accommodate pets (sorry, no exceptions). Smoking is not permitted. All stays must meet our 30-90 day min. Annual contracts are welcome.  The Brownstone: -This suite is one of several housed within the classic late 1800s era NYC brownstone townhouse known as 1871 House since 1998. The five-story Italianate style brownstone was designed by John Sexton and built in 1871 as part of a row of four single family brownstone houses -The brownstone building, which sits within the Upper East Side Historic District, presently offers a collection of one-of-a kind suites and suite apartments dedicated to the extended stay market. The generously sized suites and apartments are housed within the 5-story classic 1870's era brownstone tucked among other gorgeous townhouse and historic buildings on an inviting residential street between Park and Lexington Avenues. The historic turn-of-the-century brownstone brings style and easy access to the busy city.  -The wonderful stylized apartments of the townhouse feature a mix of antique and good quality reproduction furniture, hardwood floors, beautiful beds, en-suite private bathrooms, as well as high ceilings, marble fireplace mantels and modern amenities such as flat-screen TVs and Wi-Fi.  -Rooms in the front part of the house have quite stunning views of the townhouse mansions and brownstones immediately across the street from the house. Serene garden views to the Rear.  -The townhouse apartments offer stylish accommodations conveniently located a couple of blocks from Central Park, Madison Avenue shopping and Manhattan’s finest restaurants and cafes.  -There is virtually nothing comparable in the prime NYC location. If interested in applying:  o	Please send a quick introductory message with you inquiry.  o	Also include:  o	What brings you to the area? o	How many Guests will need to be accommodated - all individuals who would occupy the apartment must be disclosed in advance (2 guests maximum per suite). o	Please confirm you do not smoke or have a pet. Supplemental Fees & House Rules: * 	In addition to the base monthly charge, all stays are subject to supplemental fees & tax as follows: * 	A bundled flat rate monthly fee for wifi, electric, hot/cold water, heat, gas (if applicable), monthly cleaning and exit cleaning. Monthly cleanings include linen service. o	Lodging and Room Tax 5.875% + $2/room/night. * 	Guests must pay all fees & taxes if staying less than 180 days (tax waived if staying 180 days or longer)  * 	A Security Deposit * 	Third party bookings are not permitted.  *  1871 House is a converted 148-year-old Brownstone. In that it is a historic building constructed in the year 1871 there is no elevator in the building. All suites are accessed via our central open staircase. Guests must transport their luggage to their booked accommodations.  * 	Guests will be asked to fill out an informational questionnaire/application and to submit a copy of their government-issued ID. This could be a driver's license, passport or visa. * 	Guests shall use the apartments or suites for residential/living purposes only (WFH exception).  * 	Guests may work from home (home office use only) provided that no employees or clients come to the apartment.  * 	Guests are prohibited from running a business, manufacturing, selling goods or products (inventory) for the apartment or using the rented premises as an art studio to paint or to create artwork from.  * 	Smoking is not permitted in the building, rooms, apartments, terrace, in any common/public areas surrounding the Premises or including 25 feet from the building. * 	Fireplaces are decorative. * 	Guests are liable for stains on bedding, rugs, upholstery, etc. * 	Host may request to show the apartment to prospective Guests. Host will give guest advance notice. *  We ask guests to be prepared to abide by the house rules outlined in this listing and be respectful of the accommodation. * 	We may decline stand-alone one-month reservations that leave undesirable gaps in our schedule. Terms & Conditions: 1.Occupancy & Guests  a.	All individuals who would occupy the Premises during the rental term must be disclosed prior to making a reservation. b.	The occupancy agreement is based on a specific number of occupants. The number of occupants as specified in the rental agreement must be adhered to.  c.	Only guests in the original reservation whose IDs are verified in advance are permitted to stay in the apartment.  d.	If the number of guests staying in the apartment exceeds the number indicated on the confirmed reservation, the guest will be required to pay the daily charge of $100/night for each additional person not registered. e.	Overnight Guests and Supplemental Occupants: There is a supplemental fee to add a supplemental guest daily or monthly. The fee covers additional operating expenses such as wear and tear, utilities, more prep and cleaning, water (showers, toilets, sink us), supplies such as towels and bedding, laundry & internet use.  f.	The primary renter may have 1 occasional overnight guest provided the primary renter has provided the maximum occupancy limit (as stated herein) for the suite is not violated and advance notice has been provided to the host.  g.	The primary renter of the suite must be physically present if hosting an overnight guest. h.	Beds may not be added to any of the suites. 2. If a child under 10 years of age will be in occupancy (even part time) provisions must be made for the installation of window guards as per NYC regs. Guests/Occupants pay the cost of the window guards hardware and installation @ an estimated cost of $150/window (6 windows). Children under 10 years may not reside in the apartment unless window guards are installed. A lead time of 10 days is required for the arrangement of window guard installation.  3.	PETS: Guest agrees that they will not bring any PETS into the Accommodation 4.	Furniture: Guest agrees not to bring any furniture into the suite or to move furniture within the apartment. 5.	DAMAGES: Guest is liable for the full costs of any damages.The security deposit shall be returned only after inspection by Provider/Host and Provider/Host determines that no damages, loss or injury (other than from reasonable wear and tear) has been done to the premises or property therein and that all charges and fees have been paid. Any deductions from the security deposit shall be documented. Full List of Policies available by request. 130 E 62nd St is an apartment located in Manhattan County, the 10065 ZIP Code, and the attendance zone.

name: 130 E 62nd St
description: About 130 E 62nd St New York, NY 10065 We specialize in furnished short term rental apartments, extended-stay & corporate housing accommodations in the heart of New York City on the Upper East Side of Manhattan. As the Townhouse was built in 1871, it is not handicap accessible. All apartments are accessed via our central open staircase. There isn't an elevator. We regret we are unable to accommodate pets (sorry, no exceptions). Smoking is not permitted. All stays must meet our 30-90 day min. Annual contracts are welcome.  The Brownstone: -This suite is one of several housed within the classic late 1800s era NYC brownstone townhouse known as 1871 House since 1998. The five-story Italianate style brownstone was designed by John Sexton and built in 1871 as part of a row of four single family brownstone houses -The brownstone building, which sits within the Upper East Side Historic District, presently offers a collection of one-of-a kind suites and suite apartments dedicated to the extended stay market. The generously sized suites and apartments are housed within the 5-story classic 1870's era brownstone tucked among other gorgeous townhouse and historic buildings on an inviting residential street between Park and Lexington Avenues. The historic turn-of-the-century brownstone brings style and easy access to the busy city.  -The wonderful stylized apartments of the townhouse feature a mix of antique and good quality reproduction furniture, hardwood floors, beautiful beds, en-suite private bathrooms, as well as high ceilings, marble fireplace mantels and modern amenities such as flat-screen TVs and Wi-Fi.  -Rooms in the front part of the house have quite stunning views of the townhouse mansions and brownstones immediately across the street from the house. Serene garden views to the Rear.  -The townhouse apartments offer stylish accommodations conveniently located a couple of blocks from Central Park, Madison Avenue shopping and Manhattan’s finest restaurants and cafes.  -There is virtually nothing comparable in the prime NYC location. If interested in applying:  o	Please send a quick introductory message with you inquiry.  o	Also include:  o	What brings you to the area? o	How many Guests will need to be accommodated - all individuals who would occupy the apartment must be disclosed in advance (2 guests maximum per suite). o	Please confirm you do not smoke or have a pet. Supplemental Fees & House Rules: * 	In addition to the base monthly charge, all stays are subject to supplemental fees & tax as follows: * 	A bundled flat rate monthly fee for wifi, electric, hot/cold water, heat, gas (if applicable), monthly cleaning and exit cleaning. Monthly cleanings include linen service. o	Lodging and Room Tax 5.875% + $2/room/night. * 	Guests must pay all fees & taxes if staying less than 180 days (tax waived if staying 180 days or longer)  * 	A Security Deposit * 	Third party bookings are not permitted.  *  1871 House is a converted 148-year-old Brownstone. In that it is a historic building constructed in the year 1871 there is no elevator in the building. All suites are accessed via our central open staircase. Guests must transport their luggage to their booked accommodations.  * 	Guests will be asked to fill out an informational questionnaire/application and to submit a copy of their government-issued ID. This could be a driver's license, passport or visa. * 	Guests shall use the apartments or suites for residential/living purposes only (WFH exception).  * 	Guests may work from home (home office use only) provided that no employees or clients come to the apartment.  * 	Guests are prohibited from running a business, manufacturing, selling goods or products (inventory) for the apartment or using the rented premises as an art studio to paint or to create artwork from.  * 	Smoking is not permitted in the building, rooms, apartments, terrace, in any common/public areas surrounding the Premises or including 25 feet from the building. * 	Fireplaces are decorative. * 	Guests are liable for stains on bedding, rugs, upholstery, etc. * 	Host may request to show the apartment to prospective Guests. Host will give guest advance notice. *  We ask guests to be prepared to abide by the house rules outlined in this listing and be respectful of the accommodation. * 	We may decline stand-alone one-month reservations that leave undesirable gaps in our schedule. Terms & Conditions: 1.Occupancy & Guests  a.	All individuals who would occupy the Premises during the rental term must be disclosed prior to making a reservation. b.	The occupancy agreement is based on a specific number of occupants. The number of occupants as specified in the rental agreement must be adhered to.  c.	Only guests in the original reservation whose IDs are verified in advance are permitted to stay in the apartment.  d.	If the number of guests staying in the apartment exceeds the number indicated on the confirmed reservation, the guest will be required to pay the daily charge of $100/night for each additional person not registered. e.	Overnight Guests and Supplemental Occupants: There is a supplemental fee to add a supplemental guest daily or monthly. The fee covers additional operating expenses such as wear and tear, utilities, more prep and cleaning, water (showers, toilets, sink us), supplies such as towels and bedding, laundry & internet use.  f.	The primary renter may have 1 occasional overnight guest provided the primary renter has provided the maximum occupancy limit (as stated herein) for the suite is not violated and advance notice has been provided to the host.  g.	The primary renter of the suite must be physically present if hosting an overnight guest. h.	Beds may not be added to any of the suites. 2. If a child under 10 years of age will be in occupancy (even part time) provisions must be made for the installation of window guards as per NYC regs. Guests/Occupants pay the cost of the window guards hardware and installation @ an estimated cost of $150/window (6 windows). Children under 10 years may not reside in the apartment unless window guards are installed. A lead time of 10 days is required for the arrangement of window guard installation.  3.	PETS: Guest agrees that they will not bring any PETS into the Accommodation 4.	Furniture: Guest agrees not to bring any furniture into the suite or to move furniture within the apartment. 5.	DAMAGES: Guest is liable for the full costs of any damages.The security deposit shall be returned only after inspection by Provider/Host and Provider/Host determines that no damages, loss or injury (other than from reasonable wear and tear) has been done to the premises or property therein and that all charges and fees have been paid. Any deductions from the security deposit shall be documented. Full List of Policies available by request. 130 E 62nd St is an apartment located in Manhattan County, the 10065 ZIP Code, and the attendance zone.

name: 130 E 62nd St
description: About 130 E 62nd St New York, NY 10065 We specialize in furnished short term rental apartments, extended-stay & corporate housing accommodations in the heart of New York City on the Upper East Side of Manhattan. As the Townhouse was built in 1871, it is not handicap accessible. All apartments are accessed via our central open staircase. There isn't an elevator. We regret we are unable to accommodate pets (sorry, no exceptions). Smoking is not permitted. All stays must meet our 30-90 day min. Annual contracts are welcome.  The Brownstone: -This suite is one of several housed within the classic late 1800s era NYC brownstone townhouse known as 1871 House since 1998. The five-story Italianate style brownstone was designed by John Sexton and built in 1871 as part of a row of four single family brownstone houses -The brownstone building, which sits within the Upper East Side Historic District, presently offers a collection of one-of-a kind suites and suite apartments dedicated to the extended stay market. The generously sized suites and apartments are housed within the 5-story classic 1870's era brownstone tucked among other gorgeous townhouse and historic buildings on an inviting residential street between Park and Lexington Avenues. The historic turn-of-the-century brownstone brings style and easy access to the busy city.  -The wonderful stylized apartments of the townhouse feature a mix of antique and good quality reproduction furniture, hardwood floors, beautiful beds, en-suite private bathrooms, as well as high ceilings, marble fireplace mantels and modern amenities such as flat-screen TVs and Wi-Fi.  -Rooms in the front part of the house have quite stunning views of the townhouse mansions and brownstones immediately across the street from the house. Serene garden views to the Rear.  -The townhouse apartments offer stylish accommodations conveniently located a couple of blocks from Central Park, Madison Avenue shopping and Manhattan’s finest restaurants and cafes.  -There is virtually nothing comparable in the prime NYC location. If interested in applying:  o	Please send a quick introductory message with you inquiry.  o	Also include:  o	What brings you to the area? o	How many Guests will need to be accommodated - all individuals who would occupy the apartment must be disclosed in advance (2 guests maximum per suite). o	Please confirm you do not smoke or have a pet. Supplemental Fees & House Rules: * 	In addition to the base monthly charge, all stays are subject to supplemental fees & tax as follows: * 	A bundled flat rate monthly fee for wifi, electric, hot/cold water, heat, gas (if applicable), monthly cleaning and exit cleaning. Monthly cleanings include linen service. o	Lodging and Room Tax 5.875% + $2/room/night. * 	Guests must pay all fees & taxes if staying less than 180 days (tax waived if staying 180 days or longer)  * 	A Security Deposit * 	Third party bookings are not permitted.  *  1871 House is a converted 148-year-old Brownstone. In that it is a historic building constructed in the year 1871 there is no elevator in the building. All suites are accessed via our central open staircase. Guests must transport their luggage to their booked accommodations.  * 	Guests will be asked to fill out an informational questionnaire/application and to submit a copy of their government-issued ID. This could be a driver's license, passport or visa. * 	Guests shall use the apartments or suites for residential/living purposes only (WFH exception).  * 	Guests may work from home (home office use only) provided that no employees or clients come to the apartment.  * 	Guests are prohibited from running a business, manufacturing, selling goods or products (inventory) for the apartment or using the rented premises as an art studio to paint or to create artwork from.  * 	Smoking is not permitted in the building, rooms, apartments, terrace, in any common/public areas surrounding the Premises or including 25 feet from the building. * 	Fireplaces are decorative. * 	Guests are liable for stains on bedding, rugs, upholstery, etc. * 	Host may request to show the apartment to prospective Guests. Host will give guest advance notice. *  We ask guests to be prepared to abide by the house rules outlined in this listing and be respectful of the accommodation. * 	We may decline stand-alone one-month reservations that leave undesirable gaps in our schedule. Terms & Conditions: 1.Occupancy & Guests  a.	All individuals who would occupy the Premises during the rental term must be disclosed prior to making a reservation. b.	The occupancy agreement is based on a specific number of occupants. The number of occupants as specified in the rental agreement must be adhered to.  c.	Only guests in the original reservation whose IDs are verified in advance are permitted to stay in the apartment.  d.	If the number of guests staying in the apartment exceeds the number indicated on the confirmed reservation, the guest will be required to pay the daily charge of $100/night for each additional person not registered. e.	Overnight Guests and Supplemental Occupants: There is a supplemental fee to add a supplemental guest daily or monthly. The fee covers additional operating expenses such as wear and tear, utilities, more prep and cleaning, water (showers, toilets, sink us), supplies such as towels and bedding, laundry & internet use.  f.	The primary renter may have 1 occasional overnight guest provided the primary renter has provided the maximum occupancy limit (as stated herein) for the suite is not violated and advance notice has been provided to the host.  g.	The primary renter of the suite must be physically present if hosting an overnight guest. h.	Beds may not be added to any of the suites. 2. If a child under 10 years of age will be in occupancy (even part time) provisions must be made for the installation of window guards as per NYC regs. Guests/Occupants pay the cost of the window guards hardware and installation @ an estimated cost of $150/window (6 windows). Children under 10 years may not reside in the apartment unless window guards are installed. A lead time of 10 days is required for the arrangement of window guard installation.  3.	PETS: Guest agrees that they will not bring any PETS into the Accommodation 4.	Furniture: Guest agrees not to bring any furniture into the suite or to move furniture within the apartment. 5.	DAMAGES: Guest is liable for the full costs of any damages.The security deposit shall be returned only after inspection by Provider/Host and Provider/Host determines that no damages, loss or injury (other than from reasonable wear and tear) has been done to the premises or property therein and that all charges and fees have been paid. Any deductions from the security deposit shall be documented. The generously sized suites and apartments are housed within the 5-story classic 1870's era brownstone tucked among other gorgeous townhouse and historic buildings on an inviting residential street between Park and Lexington Avenues. The historic turn-of-the-century brownstone brings style and easy access to the busy city.  -The wonderful stylized apartments of the townhouse feature a mix of antique and good quality reproduction furniture, hardwood floors, beautiful beds, en-suite private bathrooms, as well as high ceilings, marble fireplace mantels and modern amenities such as flat-screen TVs and Wi-Fi.  -Rooms in the front part of the house have quite stunning views of the townhouse mansions and brownstones immediately across the street from the house. description: About 130 E 62nd St New York, NY 10065 We specialize in furnished short term rental apartments, extended-stay & corporate housing accommodations in the heart of New York City on the Upper East Side of Manhattan. As the Townhouse was built in 1871, it is not handicap accessible. All apartments are accessed via our central open staircase. There isn't an elevator. We regret we are unable to accommodate pets (sorry, no exceptions). Smoking is not permitted. All stays must meet our 30-90 day min. Annual contracts are welcome.  The Brownstone: -This suite is one of several housed within the classic late 1800s era NYC brownstone townhouse known as 1871 House since 1998. The five-story Italianate style brownstone was designed by John Sexton and built in 1871 as part of a row of four single family brownstone houses -The brownstone building, which sits within the Upper East Side Historic District, presently offers a collection of one-of-a kind suites and suite apartments dedicated to the extended stay market. The generously sized suites and apartments are housed within the 5-story classic 1870's era brownstone tucked among other gorgeous townhouse and historic buildings on an inviting residential street between Park and Lexington Avenues. The historic turn-of-the-century brownstone brings style and easy access to the busy city.  -The wonderful stylized apartments of the townhouse feature a mix of antique and good quality reproduction furniture, hardwood floors, beautiful beds, en-suite private bathrooms, as well as high ceilings, marble fireplace mantels and modern amenities such as flat-screen TVs and Wi-Fi.  -Rooms in the front part of the house have quite stunning views of the townhouse mansions and brownstones immediately across the street from the house. Serene garden views to the Rear.  -The townhouse apartments offer stylish accommodations conveniently located a couple of blocks from Central Park, Madison Avenue shopping and Manhattan’s finest restaurants and cafes.  -There is virtually nothing comparable in the prime NYC location. If interested in applying:  o	Please send a quick introductory message with you inquiry.  o	Also include:  o	What brings you to the area? o	How many Guests will need to be accommodated - all individuals who would occupy the apartment must be disclosed in advance (2 guests maximum per suite). o	Please confirm you do not smoke or have a pet. Supplemental Fees & House Rules: * 	In addition to the base monthly charge, all stays are subject to supplemental fees & tax as follows: * 	A bundled flat rate monthly fee for wifi, electric, hot/cold water, heat, gas (if applicable), monthly cleaning and exit cleaning. Monthly cleanings include linen service. o	Lodging and Room Tax 5.875% + $2/room/night. * 	Guests must pay all fees & taxes if staying less than 180 days (tax waived if staying 180 days or longer)  * 	A Security Deposit * 	Third party bookings are not permitted.  *  1871 House is a converted 148-year-old Brownstone. In that it is a historic building constructed in the year 1871 there is no elevator in the building. All suites are accessed via our central open staircase. Guests must transport their luggage to their booked accommodations.  * 	Guests will be asked to fill out an informational questionnaire/application and to submit a copy of their government-issued ID. This could be a driver's license, passport or visa. * 	Guests shall use the apartments or suites for residential/living purposes only (WFH exception).  * 	Guests may work from home (home office use only) provided that no employees or clients come to the apartment.  * 	Guests are prohibited from running a business, manufacturing, selling goods or products (inventory) for the apartment or using the rented premises as an art studio to paint or to create artwork from.  * 	Smoking is not permitted in the building, rooms, apartments, terrace, in any common/public areas surrounding the Premises or including 25 feet from the building. * 	Fireplaces are decorative. * 	Guests are liable for stains on bedding, rugs, upholstery, etc. * 	Host may request to show the apartment to prospective Guests. Host will give guest advance notice. *  We ask guests to be prepared to abide by the house rules outlined in this listing and be respectful of the accommodation. * 	We may decline stand-alone one-month reservations that leave undesirable gaps in our schedule. The occupancy agreement is based on a specific number of occupants. The number of occupants as specified in the rental agreement must be adhered to.  c.	Only guests in the original reservation whose IDs are verified in advance are permitted to stay in the apartment.  d.	If the number of guests staying in the apartment exceeds the number indicated on the confirmed reservation, the guest will be required to pay the daily charge of $100/night for each additional person not registered. e.	Overnight Guests and Supplemental Occupants: There is a supplemental fee to add a supplemental guest daily or monthly. The fee covers additional operating expenses such as wear and tear, utilities, more prep and cleaning, water (showers, toilets, sink us), supplies such as towels and bedding, laundry & internet use.  f.	The primary renter may have 1 occasional overnight guest provided the primary renter has provided the maximum occupancy limit (as stated herein) for the suite is not violated and advance notice has been provided to the host.  g.	The primary renter of the suite must be physically present if hosting an overnight guest. h.	Beds may not be added to any of the suites. 2. If a child under 10 years of age will be in occupancy (even part time) provisions must be made for the installation of window guards as per NYC regs. Guests/Occupants pay the cost of the window guards hardware and installation @ an estimated cost of $150/window (6 windows). Children under 10 years may not reside in the apartment unless window guards are installed. A lead time of 10 days is required for the arrangement of window guard installation.  3.	PETS: Guest agrees that they will not bring any PETS into the Accommodation 4.	Furniture: Guest agrees not to bring any furniture into the suite or to move furniture within the apartment. 5.	DAMAGES: Guest is liable for the full costs of any damages.The security deposit shall be returned only after inspection by Provider/Host and Provider/Host determines that no damages, loss or injury (other than from reasonable wear and tear) has been done to the premises or property therein and that all charges and fees have been paid. Any deductions from the security deposit shall be documented.
